text: Malaysian English is the dialect of English spoken in Malaysia. It (along with Malay) is an official language of Malaysia. It is used as a lingua franca between Malays, Chinese Malaysians and Indian Malaysians. English was first used in Malaysia when the British arrived in Malaysia and Singapore. == Related pages == * Manglish, a form of "broken English" used mainly by older Malaysians * Singaporean English * Singlish, a form of "broken English" used mainly by older Singaporeans Category:Dialects of English
title: Malaysian English
